CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: The PCE of P4 : PC71BM also showed a higher PCE value than P1 and P7 , with a J SC of 12.95 mA / cm^2. In contrast , the PCE suddenly decreased in the blended device of P5 and PC61BM ( 3.02% ) and further decreased in P6 ( 2.09% ) , mainly due to the significant decrease of the J SC . The low J SC values of P5 and P6 were unexpected , considering the lower band gaps of P5 ( 1.49 eV ) and P6 ( 1.55 eV ) compared to that of P7 ( 1.85 eV ). To better understand the nonlinear compositional dependence of the J SC values , the space - chargelimited current ( SCLC ) of hole - only devices of the P1 , P3 , P4 , P5 , and P7 blended devices were measured and compared ( Figure S5 ). The hole - only devices were constructed under optimized device conditions with the structure ITO / PEDOT : PSS / blends / Au. The hole mobilities of P1 , P3 , P4 , P5 , and P7 were 1.14 × 10^-4 , 1.13 × 10^-4 , 1.09 × 10^-4 , 1.10 × 10^-4 , and 1.18 × 10^-5 cm^2 / ( V s ) , respectively , showing that the hole mobilities of all random terpolymers were similar to or 1 order of magnitude higher than their parent polymers. Therefore , the trend of the J SC can not be explained solely by the changes in the optical properties and the hole mobilities. To gain a better understanding of the nonlinear compositional dependence of the J SC and PCE values of the PBDTT- DPP - TPD random terpolymers , the molecular geometries and the electron density distribution were simulated using density functional theory ( DFT ) at the B3LYP / 6-31G(d,p) level with the Spartan 08 software package. Three repeating units were taken as a model for calculations , and methyl was used instead of the long side chains to reduce the computational time. Four model compounds , ( BDTT - DPP ) 3 , (BDTT-DPP)-(BDTT-TPD)-(BDTT-DPP) , (BDTT-TPD)-(BDTT-DPP)-(BDTT-TPD) , and ( BDTT - TPD ) 3 were used and calculated for comparison. The optimized molecular geometries of the models and their calculated HOMO and LUMO frontier orbitals are depicted in Figure 5 and Figure S7. In general , for alternative copolymers , the electron density in the HOMO wave functions is well delocalized. However , the LUMO wave function shows a different degree of localization in the electron density dependent on the types of the electron - withdrawing units. 46,47 This tendency was observed in ( BDTT - DPP ) 3 and ( BDTT - TPD ) 3 .

Let's think step by step.

Sure! Let's identify the "Material Name" entities in the paragraph:

1. P4 : PC71BM - This is a blend of two materials, P4 and PC71BM.
2. P1 - This refers to the first material mentioned in the paragraph.
3. P3 - This refers to the third material mentioned in the paragraph.
4. P5 - This refers to the fifth material mentioned in the paragraph.
5. P7 - This refers to the seventh material mentioned in the paragraph.
6. PCE - This stands for "power conversion efficiency."
7. J SC - This stands for "joint space-charge limited current."
8. ITO - This stands for "indium tin oxide."
9. PEDOT - This stands for "poly(3,4-ethylenedioxythiophene)."
10. Au - This stands for "gold."
11. BDTT - This stands for "butyl-substituted diphenyl-vinylene."
12. DPP - This stands for "diphenylene-vinylene."
13. TPD - This stands for "terephthalic acid."
14. HOMO - This stands for "highest occupied molecular orbital."
15. LUMO - This stands for "lowest unoccupied molecular orbital."

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

Of course! Here are the entities that refer to "Material Name" in the paragraph:

1. P4 : PC71BM
2. P1
3. P3
4. P5
5. P7

These are the material names mentioned in the paragraph.

Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

Sure, here are the entities that clearly refer to the value of material properties in the given text:

1. PCE (Photovoltaic Conversion Efficiency): This is the value of the material property that refers to the efficiency of converting sunlight into electrical energy in a solar cell.
2. J SC (Space-Charge-Limited Current): This is the value of the material property that refers to the current density at the space-charge recombination region in a solar cell.
3. Hole mobility: This is the value of the material property that refers to the speed of holes in a material, which is an important parameter in determining the performance of a solar cell.
4. Band gap: This is the value of the material property that refers to the energy difference between the valence and conduction bands of a material, which determines the material's ability to absorb light and convert it into electrical energy.

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.
